You know, my partner’s father is an absolute asshole. Somehow, they still managed to be the wonderful person they are. But my point is that their father refuses to change or even acknowledge his mistakes, despite them trying everything they could to get through to him. And his denials and gaslighting make everything so much worse. So, I’m not trying to downplay whatever happened in your life and the lives of your children. I just want to also acknowledge that your acceptance of your mistakes and efforts to change actually do matter a great deal. At the very least, even though they don’t change the past, they offer you an opportunity to understand it and, I hope, make your own peace with it.
Same, my mom always reply  "👍"

My parents would always say "Well I'm *sorry* I can't be a better parent. If I could go back and change it I would..." in an exasparated and condescending tone. People will always find excuses not to be honest with themselves.

The weird thing is my dad taught me some valuable lessons—one being "actions speak louder than words". It was very confusing hearing one thing and seeing another until I internalized that.

I'm concerned people are actually become this stupid. Light "pollution" (aka being able to actually see most things at night), is only a thing in big cities. I grew up in a little village that often had blackouts, had to go back from school in pitch black darkness during winter. Fuck all your complains about "light pollution", people would kill to have more of it all around the world.

And no, the stars look the same without it, just dots in the sky, and yes the constellations look like these stupid lines. I remember trying to find "the bear", which is just 3 stars in a triangle, and constantly finding the wrong ones because it's all just fucking dots in the sky.
Everytime 😂 it’s like I need a chip from Elon musk for my 🧠

Yes, and roads prevent you from seeing the dirt beneath them. That doesn't make it pollution. The point is that the term "pollution" signifies something is somehow unhealthy to humans, which light is the opposite of, the darkness would be unhealthy to humans, which is why we light things up instead.

Stars are not wonder, they are dots in the sky. What you are finding is severely unhealthy delusion, from being a loser in a great society, thus leading you to romantize things you've never experienced because you think the grass is greener on the other side. Behavior like that is inexcusably stupid.
Your thinking is way lower than normal stupid human. Maga level shit.

I find joy in the beautiful cities humanity has built. The gorgeous skyscrapers and lights, that are unlike anything else in the universe. You don't even know what beauty is, you romantize things you've NEVER SEEN, that's how little joy you are. All you hippies are always miserable losers, that part of the reason I hate you.

This post describes the difference between the male and female perspectives on self help in a humorous manner. It does not disparage either side, but rather attempts to point out how men and women have different responses to mental health issues and how that reflects in self help literature. Is there anything else you need me to explain?

I think it is more descriptive than prescriptive. If a man felt fat and told his friends they would tell him to go to the gym. In the opposite scenario the woman's friends would comfort her. Both of these are good and needed for different individuals and situations. Many men would benefit from a female perspective and vice versa

Once, we were at the airport, and my friend was loudly complaining about the bathroom smell, like, "Whoa, someone's fighting for their life in there!" And out of nowhere, this dude from inside a stall yells, "Oh,sorry, did u need a private air freshener? Hate to break it to you, but we all had Taco Bell, so buckle up." The whole bathroom erupted in laughter. She never complained about a bathroom anymore hahahaha

If someone asks you what twice. Change the way you are saying it. Example: what do we have for dinner? To: what are we eating today?
